title: ISSS624
text:
Welcome to ISSS624 Geospatial Analytics Applications!
In this webpage, I am going to share with you my learning(troubleshooting) journey of geospatial analytics.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1: Geospatial Data Wrangling with R
text: In this hands-on exercise, i learned how to import and wrangle geospatial data in using appropriate R packages.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1: Geospatial Data Wrangling with R
text: In this hands-on exercise, i learned how to import and wrangle geospatial data in using appropriate R packages.

title: Hands-on Exercise 1: Geospatial Data Wrangling with R
Hands-on Ex1: Geospatial Data Wrangling with R
text:
In this hands-on exercise, i learn how to import and wrangle geospatial data in using appropriate R packages.



sf for importing, managing, and processing geospatial data, and
tidyverse for performing data science tasks such as importing, wrangling and visualising data.

Tidyverse consists of a family of R packages. In this hands-on exercise, the following packages will be used:

readr for importing csv data,
readxl for importing Excel worksheet,
tidyr for manipulating data,
dplyr for transforming data, and
ggplot2 for visualising data

The code chunk below install and load sf and tidyverse packages into R environment.

pacman::p_load(sf, tidyverse)




how to import the following geospatial data into R by using st_read() of sf package:

MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL, a polygon feature layer in ESRI shapefile format,
CyclingPath, a line feature layer in ESRI shapefile format, and
PreSchool, a point feature layer in kml file format.



below uses st_read() function of sf package to import MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL shapefile into R as a polygon feature data frame. Note that when the input geospatial data is in shapefile format, two arguments will be used, namely: dsn to define the data path and layer to provide the shapefile name. Also note that no extension such as .shp, .dbf, .prj and .shx are needed.

mpsz = st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial", 
                  layer = "MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL")

Reading layer `MP14_SUBZONE_WEB_PL' from data source 
  `C:\kekekay\ISSS624\Hands-on Ex1\data\geospatial' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 323 features and 15 fields
Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 2667.538 ymin: 15748.72 xmax: 56396.44 ymax: 50256.33
Projected CRS: SVY21


we can see the ‘Geometry Type’ is multipolygon

title: In class ex1
text:
load below 3 packages :

tmap: for the thematic mapping
sf: for s-geospatial data handling
tidyverse: for non-spatial data handling


pacman::p_load(tmap,sf,tidyverse)

title: In class ex1
text:
Importing the OD data
Firstly, we will import the Passenger Volume by origin destination bus stop dataset downloaded from LTA Datamall by using ‘read_csv()’ of readr package.

odbus <- read_csv("data/aspatial/origin_destination_bus_202308.csv")

august

odbus$ORIGIN_PT_CODE <-
as.factor(odbus$ORIGIN_PT_CODE)
odbus$DESTINATION_PT_CODE <-
as.factor(odbus$DESTINATION_PT_CODE)


#| eval:false

origtrip_7_9 <- odbus %>%
  filter(DAY_TYPE == "WEEKDAY") %>%
  filter(TIME_PER_HOUR >= 7 &
           TIME_PER_HOUR <= 9) %>%
  group_by(ORIGIN_PT_CODE) %>%
  summarise(TRIPS = sum(TOTAL_TRIPS))


busstop <- st_read(dsn = "Data/geospatial",
                   layer = "BusStop") %>%
  st_transform(crs = 3414)

Reading layer `BusStop' from data source 
  `C:\kekekay\ISSS624\In-class exercise 1\Data\geospatial' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 5161 features and 3 fields
Geometry type: POINT
Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 3970.122 ymin: 26482.1 xmax: 48284.56 ymax: 52983.82
Projected CRS: SVY21



mpsz <- st_read(dsn = "data/geospatial",
                layer = "MPSZ-2019") %>%
st_transform(crs=3414)

Reading layer `MPSZ-2019' from data source 
  `C:\kekekay\ISSS624\In-class exercise 1\Data\geospatial' using driver `ESRI Shapefile'
Simple feature collection with 332 features and 6 fields

Dimension:     XY
Bounding box:  xmin: 103.6057 ymin: 1.158699 xmax: 104.0885 ymax: 1.470775
Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84
